oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Teaching and Research in Veterinary Pharmacology and Therapeutics in the United Kingdom During the Next Decade
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lees, P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: veterinary education
joint therapeutics
pharmacology
therapeutics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Teaching pharmacology and therapeutics in the one Irish and six United Kingdom Veterinary Schools is described; current practices and future prospects are considered. Financial constraints and uncertainties concerning the future of veterinary education impose severe limitations on forward planning and new initiatives will therefore be limited in scope. Nevertheless, some positive developments can be foreseen. Joint therapeutics sessions with clinicians are strongly favoured by veterinary pharmacologists and more specialized teaching in the form of elective courses in veterinary pharmacology, therapeutics and toxicology and/or library projects is likely. Other desirable developments, such as the establishment of postgraduate courses, will not occur unless numbers of academic staff members in post are increased.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Fifth Biennial Symposium; 286-298
